info.title: Analytics API
info.description: API powering the Analytics feature of Algolia.

get.summary: Send requests to the Algolia REST API.
get.description: This method allow you to send requests to the Algolia REST API.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the API endpoint to target, anything after the /1 needs to be specified.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Query parameters to be applied to the current query.

402.description: This feature is not enabled on your Algolia account.

403.description: Method not allowed with this API key.

requestBody.description: The parameters to send with the custom request.

get.description: Returns top searches. Limited to the 1000 most frequent ones. For each search, also returns the average number of hits returned.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index name to target.

parameters.name: clickAnalytics
parameters.description: Whether to include the click-through and conversion rates for a search.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The lower bound timestamp (a date, a string like "2006-01-02") of the period to analyze.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The upper bound timestamp (a date, a string like "2006-01-02") of the period to analyze.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Reorder the results.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The sorting of the result.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of records to return. Limit is the size of the page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Position of the starting record. Used for paging. 0 is the first record.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Filter metrics on the provided tags. Each tag must correspond to an analyticsTags set at search time. Multiple tags can be combined with the operators OR and AND. If a tag contains characters like spaces or parentheses, it should be URL encoded.

searches.description: A list of top searches with their count.

nbHits.description: Number of hits that the search query matched.

searches.description: A list of top searches with their count and analytics.

averageClickPosition.description: The average position of all the click count event.

trackedSearchCount.description: The number of tracked search click.

nbHits.description: Number of hits that the search query matched.

402.description: This feature is not enabled on your Algolia account.

403.description: Method not allowed with this API key.

get.description: Returns the number of searches across the given time range. The endpoint returns a value for the complete given time range, as well as a value per day.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index name to target.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The lower bound timestamp (a date, a string like "2006-01-02") of the period to analyze.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The upper bound timestamp (a date, a string like "2006-01-02") of the period to analyze.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Filter metrics on the provided tags. Each tag must correspond to an analyticsTags set at search time. Multiple tags can be combined with the operators OR and AND. If a tag contains characters like spaces or parentheses, it should be URL encoded.

dates.description: A list of search events with their date and count.

402.description: This feature is not enabled on your Algolia account.

403.description: Method not allowed with this API key.

get.summary: Get top searches with no results.
get.description: Returns top searches that didn't return any results. Limited to the 1000 most frequent ones.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index name to target.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The lower bound timestamp (a date, a string like "2006-01-02") of the period to analyze.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The upper bound timestamp (a date, a string like "2006-01-02") of the period to analyze.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of records to return. Limit is the size of the page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Position of the starting record. Used for paging. 0 is the first record.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Filter metrics on the provided tags. Each tag must correspond to an analyticsTags set at search time. Multiple tags can be combined with the operators OR and AND. If a tag contains characters like spaces or parentheses, it should be URL encoded.

searches.description: A list of searches with no results and their count.

nbHits.description: Number of hits that the search query matched.

402.description: This feature is not enabled on your Algolia account.

403.description: Method not allowed with this API key.

get.summary: Get top searches with no clicks.
get.description: Returns top searches that didn't lead to any clicks. Limited to the 1000 most frequent ones. For each search, also returns the average number of found hits.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index name to target.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The lower bound timestamp (a date, a string like "2006-01-02") of the period to analyze.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The upper bound timestamp (a date, a string like "2006-01-02") of the period to analyze.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of records to return. Limit is the size of the page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Position of the starting record. Used for paging. 0 is the first record.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Filter metrics on the provided tags. Each tag must correspond to an analyticsTags set at search time. Multiple tags can be combined with the operators OR and AND. If a tag contains characters like spaces or parentheses, it should be URL encoded.

searches.description: A list of searches with no clicks and their count.

402.description: This feature is not enabled on your Algolia account.

403.description: Method not allowed with this API key.

get.description: Returns the rate at which searches didn't return any results. The endpoint returns a value for the complete given time range, as well as a value per day. It also returns the count of searches and searches without results used to compute the rates.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index name to target.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The lower bound timestamp (a date, a string like "2006-01-02") of the period to analyze.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The upper bound timestamp (a date, a string like "2006-01-02") of the period to analyze.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Filter metrics on the provided tags. Each tag must correspond to an analyticsTags set at search time. Multiple tags can be combined with the operators OR and AND. If a tag contains characters like spaces or parentheses, it should be URL encoded.

dates.description: A list of searches without results with their date, rate and counts.

402.description: This feature is not enabled on your Algolia account.

403.description: Method not allowed with this API key.

get.description: Returns the rate at which searches didn't lead to any clicks. The endpoint returns a value for the complete given time range, as well as a value per day. It also returns the count of searches and searches without clicks.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index name to target.

parameters.name: startDate

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Filter metrics on the provided tags. Each tag must correspond to an analyticsTags set at search time. Multiple tags can be combined with the operators OR and AND. If a tag contains characters like spaces or parentheses, it should be URL encoded.

dates.description: A list of searches without clicks with their date, rate and counts.

402.description: This feature is not enabled on your Algolia account.

403.description: Method not allowed with this API key.

get.description: Returns the distinct count of users across the given time range. The endpoint returns a value for the complete given time range, as well as a value per day.

parameters.description: The upper bound timestamp (a date, a string like "2006-01-02") of the period to analyze.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Filter metrics on the provided tags. Each tag must correspond to an analyticsTags set at search time. Multiple tags can be combined with the operators OR and AND. If a tag contains characters like spaces or parentheses, it should be URL encoded.

dates.description: A list of users count with their date.

get.summary: Get top filters for the an attribute.
get.description: Returns top filters for the given attribute. Limited to the 1000 most used filters.

parameters.name: attribute
parameters.description: The exact name of the attribute.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index name to target.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: The query term to search for. Must match the exact user input.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The lower bound timestamp (a date, a string like "2006-01-02") of the period to analyze.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The upper bound timestamp (a date, a string like "2006-01-02") of the period to analyze.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of records to return. Limit is the size of the page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Position of the starting record. Used for paging. 0 is the first record.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Filter metrics on the provided tags. Each tag must correspond to an analyticsTags set at search time. Multiple tags can be combined with the operators OR and AND. If a tag contains characters like spaces or parentheses, it should be URL encoded.

values.description: A list of filters for the given attributes.

402.description: This feature is not enabled on your Algolia account.

403.description: Method not allowed with this API key.

get.description: Returns the average click position. The endpoint returns a value for the complete given time range, as well as a value per day.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index name to target.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The lower bound timestamp (a date, a string like "2006-01-02") of the period to analyze.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The upper bound timestamp (a date, a string like "2006-01-02") of the period to analyze.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Filter metrics on the provided tags. Each tag must correspond to an analyticsTags set at search time. Multiple tags can be combined with the operators OR and AND. If a tag contains characters like spaces or parentheses, it should be URL encoded.

average.description: The average of all the click count event.

dates.description: A list of average click position with their date.

average.description: The average of all the click count event.

402.description: This feature is not enabled on your Algolia account.

403.description: Method not allowed with this API key.

get.description:
Returns the distribution of clicks per range of positions.

If the groups all have a count of 0, it means Algolia didnt receive any click events for the queries with the clickAnalytics search parameter set to true.
The count is 0 until Algolia receives at least one click event.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index name to target.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The lower bound timestamp (a date, a string like "2006-01-02") of the period to analyze.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The upper bound timestamp (a date, a string like "2006-01-02") of the period to analyze.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Filter metrics on the provided tags. Each tag must correspond to an analyticsTags set at search time. Multiple tags can be combined with the operators OR and AND. If a tag contains characters like spaces or parentheses, it should be URL encoded.

positions.description: A list of the click positions with their click count.

position.description:
Range of positions with the following pattern:
- Positions from 1 to 10 included are displayed in separated groups.
- Positions from 11 to 20 included are grouped together.
- Positions from 21 and up are grouped together.

402.description: This feature is not enabled on your Algolia account.

403.description: Method not allowed with this API key.

get.description: Returns a click-through rate (CTR). The endpoint returns a value for the complete given time range, as well as a value per day. It also returns the count of clicks and searches used to compute the rates.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index name to target.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The lower bound timestamp (a date, a string like "2006-01-02") of the period to analyze.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The upper bound timestamp (a date, a string like "2006-01-02") of the period to analyze.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Filter metrics on the provided tags. Each tag must correspond to an analyticsTags set at search time. Multiple tags can be combined with the operators OR and AND. If a tag contains characters like spaces or parentheses, it should be URL encoded.

trackedSearchCount.description: The number of tracked search click.

dates.description: A list of click-through rate events with their date.

trackedSearchCount.description: The number of tracked search click.

402.description: This feature is not enabled on your Algolia account.

403.description: Method not allowed with this API key.

parameters.description: Filter metrics on the provided tags. Each tag must correspond to an analyticsTags set at search time. Multiple tags can be combined with the operators OR and AND. If a tag contains characters like spaces or parentheses, it should be URL encoded.

trackedSearchCount.description: The number of tracked search click.

dates.description: A list of conversion events with their date.

get.description: Returns the latest update time of the analytics API for a given index. If the index has been recently created and/or no search has been performed yet the updated time will be null.
